009package imagingbook.common.image.matching.lucaskanade;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.LinearMapping2D;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
017import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
018
019/**
020 * Use to extract warped images for testing the Lucas-Kanade matcher.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 * @version 2022/09/16 made non-public
024 */
025public class ImageExtractor {
026        // TODO: replace by ImageMapper
027        
028        private int interpolationMethod = ImageProcessor.BILINEAR;
029        private final ImageProcessor I;
030        
031        /**
032         * Creates a new instance of {@link ImageExtractor} for the image {@code I}.
033         * @param I the target image.
034         */
035        public ImageExtractor(ImageProcessor I) {
036                this.I = I;
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Sets the interpolation method to be used for extracting sub-images
041         * (defined by ImageJ's {@link ImageProcessor}):
042         * {@code ImageProcessor.BILINEAR} (default),
043         * {@code NEAREST_NEIGHBOR},
044         * {@code BICUBIC} or
045         * {@code NONE}.
046         * 
047         * @param method the interpolation method to use
048         */
049        public void setInterpolationMethod(int method) {
050                this.interpolationMethod = method;
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Extracts a sub-image of size {@code width} x {@code height} from the source image 
055         * {@code I} (referenced by {@code this} {@link ImageExtractor}),
056         * using the specified transformation.
057         * The image {@code R} is extracted from a quadrilateral patch of the source image,
058         * defined by the transformation of the boundary of {@code R} by {@code T(x)}.
059         * 
060         * @param width the width of the extracted image
061         * @param height the height of the extracted image
062         * @param T a {@link LinearMapping2D} instance
063         * @return the extracted image, which is of the same type as the source image.
064         */     
065
066        public ImageProcessor extractImage(int width, int height, LinearMapping2D T) {
067                ImageProcessor R = I.createProcessor(width, height);
068                extractImage(R, T);
069                return R;
070        }
071        
072//      public ImageProcessor extractImage(int width, int height, Pnt2d[] sourcePnts) {
073//              ImageProcessor R = I.createProcessor(width, height);
074//              ProjectiveMapping2D T = getMapping(width, height, sourcePnts);
075//              extractImage(R, T);
076//              return R;
077//      }
078        
079        /**
080         * Fills the image {@code R} from the source image 
081         * {@code I} (referenced by {@code this} object).
082         * The image {@code R} is extracted from a quadrilateral patch of the source image,
083         * defined by the transformation of the boundary of {@code R} by {@code T(x)}.
084         * Grayscale and color images my not be mixed (i.e., {@code R} must be of the same type as {@code I}).
085         * @param R the image to be filled.
086         * @param T a {@link LinearMapping2D} object.
087         */     
088        public void extractImage(ImageProcessor R, LinearMapping2D T) {
089                int prevInterpolationMethod = I.getInterpolationMethod();
090                // save current interpolation method
091                I.setInterpolationMethod(interpolationMethod);
092                
093                ImageAccessor iaI = ImageAccessor.create(I);
094                ImageAccessor iaR = ImageAccessor.create(R);
095        
096                int wT = R.getWidth();
097                int hT = R.getHeight();
098                for (int u = 0; u < wT; u++) {
099                        for (int v = 0; v < hT; v++) {
100                                Pnt2d uv = PntInt.from(u, v);
101                                Pnt2d xy = T.applyTo(uv);
102                                float[] val = iaI.getPix(xy.getX(), xy.getY());
103                                iaR.setPix(u, v, val);
104                        }
105                }
106                // restore interpolation method
107                I.setInterpolationMethod(prevInterpolationMethod);
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * Extracts a warped sub-image of the associated target image I,
112         * defined by a sequence of 3 or 4 points. In the case of 3 
113         * points in sourcePnts, an {@link AffineMapping2D} is used; with 4 points,
114         * a {@link ProjectiveMapping2D} is used. The 3 or 4 points map clockwise to
115         * the corner points of the target image R, starting with the top-left corner.
116         * @param R the target image;
117         * @param sourcePnts an array of 3 or 4 {@link Pnt2d} objects.
118         */
119        public void extractImage(ImageProcessor R, Pnt2d[] sourcePnts) {
120                ProjectiveMapping2D T = getMapping(R.getWidth(), R.getHeight(), sourcePnts);
121                extractImage(R, T);
122        }
123        
124        private ProjectiveMapping2D getMapping(int w, int h, Pnt2d[] sourcePnts) {
125                Pnt2d[] targetPnts = {
126                                PntInt.from(0, 0), PntInt.from(w - 1, 0),
127                                PntInt.from(w - 1, h - 1), PntInt.from(0, h - 1)
128                        };
129                ProjectiveMapping2D T = null;
130                switch (sourcePnts.length) {
131                case (3) : T = AffineMapping2D.fromPoints(targetPnts, sourcePnts); break;
132                case (4) : T = ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(targetPnts, sourcePnts); break;
133                default : throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of source points (3 or 4 required)");
134                }
135                return T;
136        }
137        
138}
